<denchmark-code>Xcode 4.5; cannot link opencv 2.4.2 with my project:
highgui.dylib:
Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64: "cv::imread(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&, int)"
without libc++ everything works (if disable all C++11 features in my project), but I really need them. </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-code>The problem persists if you use Unix Makefiles instead of XCode: adding -std=c++11 -stdlib=libc++ to the CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS and CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS then become annoying for CUDA compilation, because the nvcc frontend receives a -dumpspecs that is not supported by clang.
